    • TUI

      public TUI(String inputIP, int inputPORT, boolean isSocket) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException, NotBoundException
      Constructor of the class.
      Parameters:
      inputIP - the IP of the server
      inputPORT - the port of the server
      isSocket - boolean indicating if the connection is a socket
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found
      NotBoundException - if the RMI registry cannot be bound

  • Method Details

    • getTraffic

      public void getTraffic()
      A method that is run by a separate Thread, it takes all the incoming messages and puts them in a queue. If the incoming message is a chat message, immediately parse it without adding it to the queue, to have a real-time chat.
      Specified by:
      getTraffic in interface View

    • execute

      public void execute() throws IOException
      A method that runs periodically on the main Thread, it takes the messages in the queue and processes them.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface View
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      Parameters:
      message - the incoming message
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      message - the message containing the usernames and colors

    • nickOrColorUsed

    • rejoin

      public void rejoin(rejoinPlayerMsg msg) throws IOException
      A method run when a player is rejoining a loaded game. It prints the usernames chosen for this game and asks the player for their choice.
      Specified by:
      rejoin in interface View
      Parameters:
      msg - the message containing the usernames

      public void alreadyPicked(cannotRejoinMsg msg) throws IOException
      A method run if the player, when rejoining, picks a username already picked in the meantime by someone else.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • setRequiredData

      public void setRequiredData(requiredDataMsg msg)
      A method that restores all the helpful information when a game is loaded and restarted. All these information where present when the player got kicked or when the match crashed, thus are mandatory to proceed the match.
      Specified by:
      setRequiredData in interface View
      Parameters:
      msg - the message containing all necessary data

    • updateLocalInitialSituation

      public void updateLocalInitialSituation(initialSituation msg) throws IOException
      A method that saved the initial data structure, consisting of the starting card, hands and common objectives. Lastly, it asks the server for the potential objective cards to choose from for the secret objective.
      Specified by:
      updateLocalInitialSituation in interface View
      Parameters:
      msg - the message containing all necessary data
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • choosePersonalObjectives

      public void choosePersonalObjectives(personalObjectivesMsg message) throws IOException
      A method run when the player has to choose its secret objective. It shows the two personal objective cards drawn, asks which one the player wants to choose, send the message to the server and, lastly, it calls the next method.
      Specified by:
      choosePersonalObjectives in interface View
      Parameters:
      message - the message containing the personal objective cards
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • updateInitialGameInfo

      public void updateInitialGameInfo(initialGameInfoMsg msg)
      A method that updates the local client with all the initial game information. Only used when a new game is started.
      Specified by:
      updateInitialGameInfo in interface View
      Parameters:
      msg - the message containing the initial game info

    • displayGameInfo

      public void displayGameInfo(gameInfoMsg message)
      A method that updates the local client with all the game information, after each turn. It is used both after a turn or when a game is reloaded (it prints the last turn played to all players). The information shown are: - int of the player who should play next - array of the scores - the last on ground card - the index of the last on ground card - placed of the last player who played
      Specified by:
      displayGameInfo in interface View
      Parameters:
      message - the message containing all useful information

    • updatePlayerSituation

      public void updatePlayerSituation(int playerID, CardSide placedCardSide)
      A method that updates the local situation of a player when he/she places a card. It also updates the placements of that player.
      Specified by:
      updatePlayerSituation in interface View
      Parameters:
      playerID - the ID of the player who placed the card
      placedCardSide - the card that was placed

    • displayPlaceableInHand

      public void displayPlaceableInHand(placeableCardsMsg message) throws IOException
      A method that prints out the placeable cards in player's hand and asks the player which one it wants to place. After that, it asks for the coordinates of the deployed card on which it wants to place it. The information is later sent to the server.
      Specified by:
      displayPlaceableInHand in interface View
      Parameters:
      message - the message containing the placeable cards in player's hand
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • displayAvailablePlacements

      public void displayAvailablePlacements(availablePlacementsMsg message) throws IOException
      A method that prints out the available corner placements to the player, who then has to decide one. After insertion, the information is forwarded to the server. If the player inserts "-1", he's sent back to choosing a card to place.
      Specified by:
      displayAvailablePlacements in interface View
      Parameters:
      message - the message containing the corners on which placement is possible
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • endGame

      public void endGame(endGameMsg message)
      A method called when the game comes to an end. It prints out the winner and the scoreboard.
      Specified by:
      endGame in interface View
      Parameters:
      message - the message containing the needed information

    • updateLocalHand

      public void updateLocalHand(newInHandMsg message)

      Specified by:
      updateLocalHand in interface View
      Parameters:
      message - the message containing the needed information
